subject: Re: testing private methods in Struts Actions ?
msgSnippet: ... This is a very interesting and good point to me. I did not think about things from this angle. :) Anyone else has any further comments about this ? ...
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...> wrote:
>
> Yes. But be careful: separate business logic from application logic.
>
> Application logic is code you write because you are a web application
> using Struts.
>
> Business logic is code you write because of the business problem you're
> solving.

This is a very interesting and good point to me. I did not think about
things from this angle. :)

Anyone else has any further comments about this ?

>
>
> So I would start with 1 business delegate per action. As the business
> delegates begin to show some duplication, I refactor them into an
> increasingly rich domain model.

This approach sounds great to me. Keep it simple at the begining,
refactor it when it has some "smell".


> I like this approach, although I must say that I never used
StrutsTestCase.
>

If you will use Struts, what testing tool you may use to test Action
related stuff ?


> Here's how to know it's business logic: "Would I do this even if I
> didn't have a computer?" That's business logic. The rest is application
> logic. :)

That's pretty simple and impressive. hehe.

>
> > English is just my second language. I am not sure whether I express
> > myself clear enough. :(
>
> Very clearly. Which is your first language?

My native language is Chinese.

By the way, the junit related books, like "Junit In Action" and
"Pragmatic Unit Testing In Java With Junit", are already available in
China market. Do you have plan to introduce your book to China ? I saw
some messages on some BBS where Chinese java programmers gather,
saying your book is "the most practical junit book ever seen". I guess
translating your book into Chinese would benefit the whole java
community in China. :)


Cheers,
- Frank


>
